ME West Elevator at 55th/56th/57th Street Back in Service
The west elevator at 55th/56th/57th Street is back in service.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=1&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME West Elevator at 51st/53rd Street/Hyde Park Out of Service
The west elevator at 51st/53rd Street/Hyde Park is out of service. Customers can use McCormick or 55th/56th/57th Street as alternate boarding stations.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - The 95th St/Chicago State University station will close March 3, 2025 - Station Rehab and Expansion Project

On Monday, March 3, the 95th st/Chicago State University station will close for approximately 2 years to undergo a rehabilitation and expansion project. During this time passengers should use 91st street and 103rd st/Rosemoor stations as alternates. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  103rd St./Rosemoor Station ADA Accessibility.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 103rd St,/Rosemoor station may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Beginning May 9, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station Reconstruction

Beginning May 9, 2025, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station reconstruction. Full site construction is expected to continue through Spring 2026. An accessible alternative is the 111th Street Morgan Park Station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - Beginning June 2, 2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction.

Beginning June 2,2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction. ADA access will resume late 2025. Passengers requiring full accessibility should use Crystal Lake station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is fully restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Michigan and Randolph Elevator Out of Service

The Michigan Avenue elevator located on the southwest corner of Michigan and Randolph is permanently out of service. Customers can use the South Water elevator, 225 N Michigan Avenue, or McCormick Place as an alternate boarding station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Morton Grove Partial Parking Outage

Due to ongoing construction of the new Morton Grove Metra Station and temporary reduction of the site's accessory parking, an existing 105-space municipal parking lot located at 8550 Lehigh Avenue will be made available to the public for permit parking starting August 1, 2025, through October 31, 2025. Click here for more details.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Games at Soldier Field
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for Chicago home games at Soldier Field. For more information click here and visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - University Park Station Parking Lot Entry Canopies Refurbished (UPDATE)

University Park Station west parking lot entry canopies will be refurbished from November 3 through Winter 2026.

Passengers will not have access to the west parking Lot platform entry from November 3 through winter 2026. Passengers will have full access to the esst parking lot platform entry through Winter 2026. During these closures passengers should use the east parking lot for all access.

Customers are encouraged to use Richton Park for full access during the construction period.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert - Metra Bike Policy Changes

Metra amends the bike policy to address safety concerns with large, heavy e-bikes and e-scooters.  Customers are now required to be able to carry their bikes and scooters on and off the train themselves without assistance. For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-N - Peterson Ridge - Parking Lot Construction Project

Parking lot construction will be taking place at the Peterson Ridge station beginning October 13 lasting approximately 3 weeks. During this time some parking spots will be inaccessible. Signage will be posted advising commuters where they can park. Commuters should give themselves additional time when heading to the station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Forest Glen Station Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, October 22, the northwest staircase at Forest Glen station will be out of service for rehabilitation for 6-8 weeks. Please use the southwest staircase at N Elston Ave, to access Platform 2.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric to Operate on a Sunday Schedule on Saturday, October 25

On Saturday, October 25, the Metra Electric line will operate on a Sunday schedule due to construction work associated with the South Shore Line's expansion plans. Please allow additional travel time.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric Partial Shut Down on Sunday, Nov. 2 - South Shore Expansion Project

On Sunday, Nov. 2, Metra Electric trains will terminate and originate from the 18th Street Station due to the South Shore expansion project. During this time, no service will be available at Museum Campus/11th Street and Van Buren Street stations.

For ADA customers and customers who have difficulty using stairs, Pace Paratransit vehicles will shuttle riders via the McCormick Place busway between the Millennium and McCormick Place Stations. All other customers wishing to travel to Millennium Station must transfer to a shuttle bus at the 18th Street Station. If you need help or have questions, please see Metra personnel for assistance.

Click here for more details.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Grayslake Platform Rehabilitation Project

Beginning Saturday, October 25 through mid-December, the platform at Grayslake/Lake Street station will be replaced. Approximately 400 feet of the platform from the paid parking to the east end of the platform will be out of service. In addition, the staircase at the east end of the platform will also be out of service. Please use caution near the work area during this time.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert BNSF - Track Changes On South Concourse At Chicago Union Station - Saturday, October 25, 2025

On  Saturday, October 25, tracks 6 and 8 on the south concourse at Chicago Union Station will be out of service due to Amtrak station repairs. Passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need assistance, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Track Changes On North Concourse At Chicago Union Station

During this evening rush hour, trains on the north concourse will depart from different tracks due to schedule repairs on track 11. Milwaukee District and North Central Service passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need assistance, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert NCS - Track Changes On North Concourse At Chicago Union Station

During this evening rush hour, trains on the north concourse will depart from different tracks due to schedule repairs on track 11. Milwaukee District and North Central Service passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need assistance, please contact Metra personnel for help.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-W - Track Changes On North Concourse At Chicago Union Station

During this evening rush hour, trains on the north concourse will depart from different tracks due to schedule repairs on track 11. Milwaukee District and North Central Service passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need assistance, please contact Metra personnel for help.
